questions.question_text:
A customer wants to use AWS for Cisco SD-WAN IaaS services by deploying virtual SD-WAN routers in a transit AWS VPC. The transit VPC then connects via site-to-site IPsec tunnels to an AWS transit gateway.

Which transit VPC connects via site-to-site IPsec tunnels to an AWS transit gateway?

discussion.content:
I think this should be D...
https://community.cisco.com/t5/networking-knowledge-base/sd-wan-routers-troubleshoot-control-connections/ta-p/3813237
Definitely D. A quick search in google for the Error code.

Selected Answer: D
Should be D

Selected Answer: D
CRTREJSER indicates a missing serial number for vEdge routers and vSmart controllers.
Resolution: 
When ever you get this kinds of errors make sure you check the serial number on the vManage screen and update, Once update please send it to all controllers

Selected Answer: D
another source, and I agree that answer is D
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/routers/sd-wan/214509-troubleshoot-control-connections.html#toc-hId-1981257189
If the serial number is not present on the controllers for a given device, the control connections fail.
When you troubleshoot such a problem, ensure that the correct serial number and device model was configured and provisioned on the PnP portal (software.cisco.com) and vManage.

choices.D: Send the serial number to vBond from the vManage controller.
choices.A: Rectify the Root CA certificate mismatch on WAN Edge devices.
choices.C: Install the bootstrap code on WAN Edge and check for CSR.
choices.B: Resolve the ZTP reachability and rectify smart account credentials issue.

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

Drag and drop the alarm states from the left onto the corresponding alarm descriptions on the right.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
A Minor (green)—Events that might diminish the performance of a network function
B Major (yellow)—Serious events that affect, but do not shut down, the operational of a network function.
C Critical (red)—Serious events that impair or shut down the operation of an overlay network function.
D Medium (blue)—Events that might impair the performance of a network function.

• Critical (red)—Serious events that impair or shut down the operation of an overlay network function. 
• Major (yellow)—Serious events that affect, but do not shut down, the operational of a network function.
• Medium (blue)—Events that might impair the performance of a network function.
• Minor (green)—Events that might diminish the performance of a network function

questions.question_text: Which two mechanisms are used by vManage to ensure that the certificate serial number of the WAN Edge router that is needed to authenticate is listed in the WAN Edge Authorized Serial Number list? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
Trick answer - Sync TO the PnP, when actually the Vmanage Syncs FROM PnP, on vManage the option is "Sync Smart Account"
"SYNC TO VMANAGE. The next thing to do is to sync the routers from PnP into vManage. Login to your vManage instance using the link provided in the self-service portal, and navigate to Configuration > Devices. Under the “WAN Edge List” tab click the “Sync Smart Account” link on the top bar of the page"

Selected Answer: AD
Smart account and PnP are two different things. Smart account is for admin license and PnP to create white list

Selected Answer: CD
C & D
You can either SYNC it via vManage or download the list from PnP and upload the file to Vmanage
C & D guys. vManage Sync with the Cisco Smart account and adds devices to the list automatically when you purchase them. The other way is uploading a list manually to vManage.

comments.content: You literally said in the comment that the Smart Account is synched with vManage. That's option C.

discussion.content:
The correct answer is A & D.
This cisco white paper states using the auto sync option, where your Smart Account is synced with Cisco vManage. This option requires Cisco vManage to be able to connect with the Cisco Plug n Play (PnP) portal
Or Using the manual upload method, where you download the authorized serial number file of devices from the Cisco PnP portal and upload it to Cisco vManage

Reference:-
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/configuration/sdwan-xe-gs-book/m-quick-connect-workflow.html

Selected Answer: AD
WAN Edge device can be retrieved from the Plug and Play (PnP) Connect portal
or the administrator can download the list manually and upload it to vManage.

so i would say A and D

comments.content: the option is under administration under settings in vmanage
you mean C and D.. there is no option to sync with PnP

discussion.content: would A and D not be more correct?

Selected Answer: CD
C and D
Shouldn't this be C and D

choices.B: The vManage is shipped with the list.
choices.E: The devices register to vManage directly as the devices come online.

questions.question_text: Which component is responsible for creating and maintaining the secure DTLS/TLS connection on the vSmart controller?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A Cisco SD-WAN daemon running on each vSmart controller and router creates and maintains the secure DTLS or TLS connections between the devices. This daemon is called vdaemon .
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/configuration/security/vedge/security-book/security-overview.html
